programmes.show_description: Paramedics treat a man who's been stabbed in the chest, a young man who may have life-threatening sepsis and a diabetic woman with high blood sugar readings.
Leo is in A&E after crashing his car and flipping it onto its roof. Young Kieran's hurt his wrist coming off his skateboard. And 91-year-old Lillian has had a hard fall at home.
Colin has collapsed in his garage. Is it a stroke or linked to his brain tumour diagnosis? Dr Yuki reflects on life in lockdown. Tony, who's 88, has severe pain in his fingers.
Some favourite investigations. Jimmy Doherty looks at how squid and chips could become our national dish. Kate Quilton reports on kangaroo meat. Matt Tebbutt investigates pesto.
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
House-hunters Amanda and Keith from Wiltshire are searching for a holiday home in the hillside villages of western Cyprus. With £250,000, Leah Charles-King shows them five great options.
Emma and Shane dream of owning a holiday home on Madeira for them, Emma's two daughters and their dog Callie to enjoy. Can Ben Hillman deliver the perfect place for their budget of £200k?
Danni Menzies helps motorbike lovers Gary and Lynn look for their dream holiday home in France's stunning Haute-Vienne region. Will any of Danni's options get them revved up?
The competition kicks off at Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson's Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire. There's a battle of the breakfasts and feedback that cuts deep.
Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize host at The Railway Inn near Hull. Their guests find little to complain about, but the pressure is on for Luke's breakfast.
Sarah and Pete Healey welcome their rivals to The Driftwood B&B in Weymouth. Cathy and Genice find the place shipshape, and Lygia prepares to party when she spots disco balls.
The final visit is to The Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman and breakfast chef Mary Murray pride themselves on a luxury stay. But emotions run high.
It's the final day of the competition and the B&Bers meet for one last time to find out how much they've been paid. There's some surprising feedback before the winner is announced.
Kent. The first host, construction site manager and part-time bouncer Mark, wants his night to be as much about the fun as the food, with party poppers and confetti cannons. (Ep1/5)
Kent. Competitive sales assistant Verush hosts a Czech evening with traditional food. But one guest compares her pasta to MDF and her pastry to leather... (Ep2/5)
Kent. Dog lover Karen hosts a British bulldog bonanza, with every course inspired by her precious pooches. But will she be top dog at the end of the competition? (Ep3/5)
Kent. Musician Amrick, who's been keeping his musical talents a secret, finally reveals all, on a night of traditional Indian cuisine and questionable dress sense. (Ep4/5)
Kent. Photographer Anthony plans to impress his guests with culinary excellence on the final night. Mark's on cheesy overdrive, and Karen showcases some incredible impressions. (Ep5/5)
Dad and daughter Dennis and Holly kick off the competition at their boutique B&B in Norwich, where one guest isn't full of beans at breakfast.
Visit two is to Hawkhurst in Kent, where the B&Bers enjoy a fer-mental afternoon on the beers at a microbrewery courtesy of hosts Harry and Sarah.
In Oxfordshire, Dawn takes her guests on a tour around Blenheim Palace. All that walking should have everyone knackered - so why does one B&Ber have a restless night?
Ollie hopes his French-styled B&B - No 64 at the Joiners in Kent - will have that je ne sais quoi to win the competition. But things get heated in the kitchen during breakfast service.
It's payment day. After a battle of the boutique B&Bs all week, the boutique B&Bers meet up one final time to find out which boutique B&B is the best boutique B&B.
Roofer Mark, who's 54, has fallen 10 feet off a ladder. Joan has severe pain in her chest, arm and jaw. And Josie has hit her head while performing a Dirty Dancing routine on a hen do.
Anthony is in resus with possible internal bleeding after coming off his bike. And Jack is transferred to St George's with suspected nerve damage after falling off his e-scooter.
A cyclist is in A&E with serious puncture wounds after colliding with a deer. Doctors are concerned 34-year-old Jenny is having a heart attack. And toddler Teddy has a limp.
The paramedics are called out to a man who has overdosed on drugs, a woman who's losing blood fast, and another man who may have had a stroke.
The paramedics are called out to a woman who's had a seizure on a bus, a man who's too weak to reach his oxygen supply, and a young woman with terminal cancer who's collapsed.
Anthony is in resus with possible internal bleeding after coming off his bike. And Jack is transferred to St George's with suspected nerve damage after falling off his e-scooter.
A cyclist is in A&E with serious puncture wounds after colliding with a deer. Doctors are concerned 34-year-old Jenny is having a heart attack. And toddler Teddy has a limp.
All the inside info from your supermarket's vegan aisle - from plant-based burger trends and snappy vegan sausage skin, to quiche without eggs. And exactly how do you milk an oat? (Ep2/4)
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Pauline and Chris dream of owning a bolthole in the beautiful coastal town of Peyia in western Cyprus. Can Jasmine Harman find them the perfect holiday home for £80k?
Linda is looking for a holiday home in Paphos on the west coast of Cyprus. Can Scarlette Douglas find a property that ticks all of Linda's boxes for her £80,000 budget?
Laura Hamilton helps Paul and Linda look for their perfect holiday home close to the resort of Vale do Lobo, on Portugal's beautiful Algarve coast, for their budget of £325k.
Michelle and Gary Cole are looking for a holiday home where they can spend quality family time together. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties on the Costa Blanca for their £65k budget.
Sussex. Part-time comedian Rod hopes to impress his guests with his extensive dinner party experience. But will some bovine booing and enthusiastic plate licking ruin his chances? (Ep1/5)
Sussex. Mystic and animal communicator Josie serves up an evening of spiritual shenanigans, assisted by her best friend, Mimi the cat. But will her guests be soothed or spooked? (Ep2/5)
Sussex. Food hub charity director Paula takes inspiration from her job for her recycle and reuse themed evening, featuring an aquacotta starter and an impressive pud. (Ep3/5)
Sussex. Vegan solicitor Hassan's menu is inspired by his love of Asian food, but a spice slip-up has some of his guests hot and bothered. Can dessert make up for his chilli chaos? (Ep4/5)
Sussex. Jewellery entrepreneur Sarah tops off the week with some simple and nutritious food. But will a dodgy dessert and tears at the table take the shine off her evening? (Ep5/5)
Sylvia's planning a permanent move to the Dordogne in France. Craig Rowe shows her five impressive properties for her budget of £250k, but will any of them be the perfect one?

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: Kirstie and Phil help newly-weds Nikki and Andy deal with their fiercely divided feelings over their cluttered terrace home in Northampton. Will they stay or go?
In south Devon, Kirstie Allsopp scours a sought-after seaside town where there's nothing for sale. And Phil Spencer meets a couple who are looking for a place to raise chickens.
Liam and Patrycja treat their guests to an afternoon of pie making during a visit to their B&B in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire.
Father and daughter Shane and Emily hope to dazzle with the décor at their place in Hampshire, before a visit to a farm descends into mudslinging - literally.
The B&Bers visit Simon and Harriet's old-school village pub in Northamptonshire, where the bacon gets a bashing at breakfast.
Louis and Michael's luxurious interiors wow their guests in Suffolk. But one pair are perturbed by the hosts' lavish approach.
The B&Bers meet one last time on payment day to clash over cleanliness and spar over sleep scores, before the payments are revealed and we find out who's won.
Brand new series: Paramedics treat a woman showing signs of a stroke, a mum who has terrible pain in her face and a woman who has a swollen stomach and hasn't eaten for two days.
Kerrie, who's 52, is rushed to A&E with a suspected stroke. Jitendra has severely cut his hand while cooking for his family. And Bayan, who's 24, is experiencing facial numbness.
Eighty-year-old Michael has suspected sepsis. Sayfur has had an epileptic seizure. And diving coach Laura, who's a bit of a daredevil, has broken her ankle while ice skating.
